caption: This photograph captures an ornate, old cemetery scene featuring individual fenced graves in a field of brown grass. The predominant element in the image is an aged, wrought iron fence, intricately designed with pointed finials and decorative elements including a heart shape on the entrancing gate. At the center of this fenced enclosure is a weathered tombstone, barely readable, slightly tilted, and surrounded by sparse, dried grass indicating a lack of recent care. In the background, there are similar graves, each enclosed by similar metal fences, suggesting a pattern across the burial ground. The setting appears quiet and desolate, under an overcast sky, which contributes to the somber and historical ambiance of the scene.
title: Graves of some of the first Leakey settlers.
